data.title: Orange Bowl How to Watch Georgia vs Florida State, Radio, streaming rundown
data.meta_description: Everything you need to know to take in the 2023 Orange Bowl.
data.text:
MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. — The No. 6 ranked Georgia Bulldogs are set to take the field on Sunday to face No. 5 Florida State. Here's the rundown on what to expect in the 2023 Orange Bowl game.

TV, Streaming Info

Kickoff: 4 p.m.ET, Saturday, Dec. 30

TV: ESPN

Streaming: FuboTV

Location: Hard Rock Stadium

Weather: Partly Cloudy, 65°, feels like 64°.

Announcing Crew:

TV - Joe Tessitore (play-by-play), Jesse Palmer (color analyst), Katie George (sideline reporter)

Atlanta -- 750 AM/95.5 FM - Scott Howard (play-by-play), Eric Zeier (color analyst), DJ Shockley (sideline reporter)

2016 Record:

Georgia went 8-4, with a 4-4 Southeastern Conference record and a 31-23 win over TCU in the Liberty Bowl.

Florida State went 10-3, with a 5-3 Atlantic Coast Conference record, and a 33-32 win over Michigan in the Orange Bowl.

2017 Record:

Georgia went 13-2, with a 7-1 Southeastern Conference record, a 28-7 win over Auburn in the SEC Championship, a 54-48 win over Oklahoma in the Rose Bowl College Football Playoff Semifinal, and a 26-23 loss to Alabama in the College Football Playoff National Championship.

Florida State went 7-6, with a 3-5 Atlantic Coast Conference record, and a 42-13 win over Southern Miss in the Independence Bowl.

2018 Record:

Georgia went 11-3 with a 7-1 Southeastern Conference record, a 35-28 loss to Alabama in the conference championship, and a 28-21 loss to Texas in the Sugar Bowl.

Florida State went 5-7, with a 3-5 Atlantic Coast Conference record

2019 Record:

Georgia went 12-2 with a 7-2 Southeastern Conference record, a 37-10 loss to LSU in the conference championship, and a 26-14 win over Baylor in the Sugar Bowl.

Florida State went 6-7, with a 4-4 Atlantic Coast Conference record and a 20-14 loss to Arizona State in the Sun Bowl.

2020 record:

Georgia went 8-2, with a 7-2 Southeastern Conference record and a 24-21 win over Cincinnati in the Chick-Fil-A Peach Bowl.

Florida State went 3-6, with a 2-6 Atlantic Coast Conference record

2021 record:

Georgia went 14-1, with an 8-0 Southeastern Conference record, a 41-24 loss to Alabama in the SEC Championship, a 34-11 win over Michigan in the Orange Bowl CFP semifinal, and a 33-18 win over Alabama in the College Football Playoff National Championship.

Florida State went 5-7, with a 4-4 Atlantic Coast Conference record

2022 record:

Georgia went 15-0, with an 8-0 Southeastern Conference record, a 50-30 win over LSU in the SEC Championship, a 42-41 win over Ohio State in the CFP Semifinal, and a 65-7 win over TCU in the CFP National Championship.

Florida State went 10-3, with a 5-3 Atlantic Coast Conference record and a 35-32 win over Oklahoma in the Cheez-it Bowl

2023 record:

Georgia is 12-1, with an 8-0 Southeastern Conference record and a 27-24 loss to Alabama in the SEC Championship.

Florida State is 13-3, with an 8-0 Atlantic Coast Conference record and a 16-6 win over Louisville in the ACC Championship.

Coaching staff:

Georgia:Head coachKirby Smart(eighth season), offensive coordinatorMike Bobo(fifteenth season, eighth as offensive coordinator, first season under Smart),co-defensive coordinatorGlenn Schumann(eighth season, fourth as co-defensive coordinator), co-defensive coordinatorWill Muschamp(third season, second as co-defensive coordinator)

Florida State: Head coach Mike Norvell (fourth season), offensive coordinator Alex Atkins (second season), co-defensive coordinator Adam Fuller (fourth overall season), co-defensive coordinator Randy Shannon (second season)

Series history: Georgia leads the all-time series against Florida State 6-4-1, with the Dawgs winning the last meeting 26-13 in the 2003 Sugar Bowl.

The Bulldogs are now 93-16 under eighth-year head coach Kirby Smart, with a 56-9 record in conference play.

"We’re excited to get down here," Kirby Smart said Tuesday after arriving in Miami. "We had a Monday practice on Christmas Day, we got a Tuesday practice in this morning. We wanted to get down here so we could get used to the weather a little bit tomorrow, and hopefully avoid rain on Thursday. But our guys have been great. Had really good practices the last two days. Practice has been a lot better since we came back. Got a lot of midyears here. I’m excited to see how these guys are going to play."
